fields.value: Technical Analysis in the Foreign Exchange Market:  A Layman's Guide

authorAffiliation.value: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis

dsDescriptionValue.value: Economists have traditionally been skeptical of the value  of technical analysis, the use of past price behavior to guide trading  decisions in asset markets. Instead, they have relied on the logic of  the efficient markets hypothesis. This research briefly explains the  fundamentals of technical analysis and the efficient markets  hypothesis as applied to the foreign exchange market, evaluates the  profitability of simple trading rules, and reviews recent ideas that might justify extrapolative technical analysis.
